definition: front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

sentences.english: You won’t want to linger there long when you see the front porch.
sentences.chinese: 当你看到前廊的时候，你不会想在起居室里久待。

sentences.english: He looked at her intently in the faint light of the porch.
sentences.chinese: 在前廊昏黄的亮光里，他凝神望着她。

sentences.english: He made a comment about our front porch needing paint.
sentences.chinese: 他又说道，我们屋子的前廊需要重新用油漆刷一下。

sentences.english: I came to know his honor as we was drinking beer on the porch.
sentences.chinese: 他说起这事时，我们正坐在他家的前廊喝啤酒。

sentences.english: The narthex is usually separated from the nave by columns or a pierced wall.
sentences.chinese: 一般用柱子或开了门洞的墙将前廊与中堂分隔开。

definition: courtyard/atrium/opening in a roof/skylight/caisson ceiling/(TCM) acupuncture point TB10
winding corridor/cloister/ambulatory (covered walkway around a cloister)
a screen wall across the gate of a house (for privacy)
interlocking wooden brackets between the top of a column and crossbeams used in traditional Chinese architecture
